private_information: I currently hold disks (top->bottom): A, B, C, D, E, where A is smallest and E is largest.
left_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg while maintaining legal stacking (never place a larger disk on a smaller one).

middle_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg while maintaining legal stacking (never place a larger disk on a smaller one).

right_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg while maintaining legal stacking (never place a larger disk on a smaller one).

orchestrator.goal: Generate a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance so that all disks move from left to right following the rules, targeting the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 5 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E where A is the smallest and E is the largest.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg is empty; middle peg is empty; right peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for producing a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem for this multi-peg Tower of Hanoi instance. Target solver: FastDownwards. Keep the agents' roles and actions distinct and reflect the physical rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller one. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive short state descriptions from each peg: {pddl->input}. Integrate these descriptions with the public information: {environment->public_information} and the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the pegs, disks (A smallest to E largest), the legal move actions, initial state, and goal state. Ensure actions for moving disks are parameterized and keep the notion of which agent (peg) is the source and which is the target explicit so the solver can output a plan. Target the FastDownwards solver by keeping the PDDL STRIPS-compatible and avoid solver-specific extensions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
